column4: Hi all, quick question "sudo apt-get install flash-plugin" should work yes ?
no.  Why not just visit a page that requires flash in firefox and click on the yellow bar that pops up?
you need to enable the multiverse repository
But i took a list from my other machine, i don't see how that machine could have the package and this one can't
pastebin your sources.list, the command you are using, and the full output
I am not familiar with pastebin
Sorry for the delay, yeah but i don't care if automatix isn't working .  I just want to be able to install some simple packages
the issue is not whether or not automatix is working.  The issue is automatix breaks other things
pastebin the command you are executing and errors you are getting as well
I don't see any issue, there are just three packages that do not exist.  adobereader and flashplugin-nonfree are what you are missing.  adobe reader is probably in medibuntu with some other name
